attributes.action: recognise that  divorced parents of disabled children have the same need to maintain contact with their children as other parents.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
DISABLED CHILDREN NEED BOTH PARENTS – DON’T MAKE THEM CHOOSE.
A disabled child with two families (following marriage breakdown) has the same needs in both homes. The grants and benefits that are available only go to one parent.  Unless the second parent can fund the necessary aids and adaptations privately, or though charitable donations, the child cannot stay with them.  This affects the parent/child relationship and means that the child has to go to strangers if respite care is needed - at a cost to the authorities.

1 IN 4 DISABLED CHILDREN LIVES IN A SINGLE PARENT HOUSEHOLD
